title: Ariana Grande's Tattoo Collection Includes 50+ Tiny Designs
description: Ariana Grande's tattoo collection has been in the making for years. She may not be the most tattooed celebrity in history, but her collection of ink is still pretty impressive. Over the years, the "Wicked" star has amassed more than 50 designs, and she doesn't appear to be slowing down anytime soon. In fact, she revealed in a recent interview on "The Kelly Clarkson Show" that she and costar Cynthia Erivo have gotten a bunch of new designs for the movie, including a few matching inks and an illustration of the original Glinda from the 1900s book. Grande's tattoos span her entire body, from her neck down to her feet, and each one is uniquely her. Many tell a story and hold sentimental value. She has a tattoo of the nickname her grandfather gave her, a few that reference her favorite movies, and various other culture–related designs (like a "Breakfast at Tiffany's" quote). She also has a long list of designs that represent her career in music, like a "Sweetener" World Tour tattoo she got with her bandmates. But that's not to say that all of Grande's tattoos are meticulously thought out or always go as planned. There was that incident with the infamous "7 Rings" tattoo, and over the years, she's had to get quite a few old tattoos from past relationships covered up. Some of the star's designs are in not-so-obvious spots, like her ribcage, while others are on full display. By far, her easiest designs to spy are her many hand and finger tattoos. The star has also been slowly getting a handful of her older designs lasered off, including the Eevee "Pokémon" tattoo on her inner arm. But fear not: we rounded up her full collection ahead. To get a closer look at Grande's tattoos and learn about their meanings, read on.
author: Nykia Spradley
excerpt: Ariana Grande has more than 50 tattoos. See Grande's ear tattoos, finger tattoos, and ink for her past relationships.
text: Ariana Grande's tattoo collection has been in the making for years. She may not be the most tattooed celebrity in history, but her collection of ink is still pretty impressive. Over the years, the "Wicked" star has amassed more than 50 designs, and she doesn't appear to be slowing down anytime soon. In fact, she revealed in a recent interview on "The Kelly Clarkson Show" that she and costar Cynthia Erivo have gotten a bunch of new designs for the movie, including a few matching inks and an illustration of the original Glinda from the 1900s book. Grande's tattoos span her entire body, from her neck down to her feet, and each one is uniquely her. Many tell a story and hold sentimental value. She has a tattoo of the nickname her grandfather gave her, a few that reference her favorite movies, and various other culture–related designs (like a "Breakfast at Tiffany's" quote). She also has a long list of designs that represent her career in music, like a "Sweetener" World Tour tattoo she got with her bandmates. But that's not to say that all of Grande's tattoos are meticulously thought out or always go as planned. There was that incident with the infamous "7 Rings" tattoo, and over the years, she's had to get quite a few old tattoos from past relationships covered up. Some of the star's designs are in not-so-obvious spots, like her ribcage, while others are on full display. By far, her easiest designs to spy are her many hand and finger tattoos. The star has also been slowly getting a handful of her older designs lasered off, including the Eevee "Pokémon" tattoo on her inner arm. But fear not: we rounded up her full collection ahead. To get a closer look at Grande's tattoos and learn about their meanings, read on.Getty | Karwai TangAriana Grande's "For Good" Palm TattooOn the inside of Grande's hand, she has a script tattoo of the famous phrase, "For Good." The design matches one on Erivo's opposite palm, so they touch when they hold hands, according to the actors.Getty | Tim P. WhitbyAriana Grande's "E" Heart TattooGrande and Erivo got a watching heart tattoo on the back of their legs. Grande's ink has an "E" for Elphaba, and Erivo's heart has a "G" for Glinda. Getty | Karwai TangAriana Grande's Original Glinda Illustration TattooGrande has a tattoo of Glinda on the back of her right hand from the original "The Wonderful Wizard of Oz" book by L. Frank Baum, which was published in 1900. In the tattoo, the good witch is drawn sitting in a chair with a clock behind her. "When they come to me, I just get them," the actor said of the ink in a 2023 interview with Allure. "This one I knew I wanted to get for a very long time. . . I waited forever to fill up this hand. And I thought, 'I'm gonna wait for the right thing to come along,' and yeah, that felt very right."Getty | Karwai TangAriana Grande's Poppy Flower Hand TattooSometime in 2023 while filming "Wicked," Grande added a poppy flower tattoo to the side of her right hand. The design is in black ink. Erivo also has one on the side of her hand to match.Getty | NBCAriana Grande's Umbrella Hand TattooOn the side of her left hand, Grande has a tiny umbrella tattoo next to the larger moon design.Getty | NBCAriana Grande's Saturn Hand TattooAlong with the rest of her collection of hand tattoos, Grande has a tiny design of Saturn on her left hand.Getty | Karwai TangAriana Grande's Right Hand and Finger TattoosGrande has a long list of finger and hand tattoos. On her right hand, she has more than 10 designs. Ariana Grande's "Honeymoon" Finger Tattoo In honor of her The Honeymoon Tour for her first album, Grande got the word "Honeymoon" inked on the side of her middle finger. Ariana Grande's "Baby Doll" Finger Tattoo Another early tattoo of Grande's is the words "Baby Doll" inked on the other side of her middle finger. It's the nickname her nonna called her. Ariana Grande's Heart Finger Tattoo On the top of her ring finger, Grande has the outline of a heart in black ink. Ariana Grande's "אלד" Finger Tattoo Next to the heart ink is a middle-finger tattoo of the Hebrew phrase "אלד." She got it in 2014 and it means "guarding and protecting." Ariana Grande's "A" Finger Tattoo In 2016, Grande got an "A" tattooed on her thumb for one of her closest friends, Alexa. Ariana Grande's "Lumos" Hand Tattoo Grande has the word "lumos" — a spell used in the Harry Potter series to produce light — tattooed on her left hand. However, it appears she covered it up with a branch. Ariana Grande's "H2GKMO" Finger Tattoo Another popular Grande finger tattoo is the acronym for her favorite phrase, "Honest to God, Knock Me Out," on her right thumb.Ariana Grande's "9 3/4" Finger Tattoo On her index finger, Grande has another Harry Potter tattoo: the number "9 3/4" for platform 9 3/4 at King's Cross Station. However, she's since covered it with a branch of laurel leaves that wraps around her finger. Ariana Grande's "GWS" Finger Tattoo Grande added a tattoo that reads "GWS" for "Get Well Soon" to her collection of finger designs in June 2020. The ink, on her ring finger, is for her song off the "Sweetener" album. Ariana Grande's "XV" Finger Tattoo The Roman numeral "XV" is inked on Grande's right pinky finger. It represents her wedding date to Dalton Gomez: May 15, 2021. Ariana Grande's "For Good" Hand Tattoo In May 2023, fans spotted a new tattoo on Grande's palm. It reads "for good," presumably in honor of her role as Glinda in the upcoming film adaptation of the Broadway musical "Wicked."Getty | Karwai TangAriana Grande's Left Hand and Finger TattoosGrande's left hand is equally decorated with ink. She has more than 10 designs. Ariana Grande's Venus Finger Tattoo One of Grande's most famous finger tattoos is the Venus symbol on her left hand. It can be seen on her finger just above the knuckle. Ariana Grande's Cloud Finger Tattoo On her left hand, Grande has a small cloud hovering above the Venus symbol. She got the design with Pete Davidson when they were dating. Ariana Grande's "561" Finger Tattoo The area code 561 for her hometown, Boca Raton, FL, is inked on Grande's left thumb. Ariana Grande's "Reborn" Hand Tattoo In 2018, Grande and Davidson got matching hand tattoos that read "reborn." However, after their split, she covered the design with a branch. Ariana Grande's "Pete" Finger Tattoo Grande had Davidson's first name, "Pete," tattooed on her ring finger. It's since been covered with a solid black heart. Ariana Grande's Abstract Finger Tattoos Grande has a few abstract tattoos on her right hand. This includes a black rectangle that covers the heart ink, some arrow designs, black dots by her fingernails, and an evil-eye tattoo. Ariana Grande's "Cinderella" Finger Tattoos After Miller's death, Grande got "Cinderella" tattooed on the inside of her left index finger. It's for the rapper's song by the same name, which was written for her.GettyAriana Grande's "Baby" Arm TattooSome eagle-eyed fans noticed that Grande has a tattoo that says "baby" on her left arm. It's near her Eevee body art and under her butterfly designs.Getty | NBCAriana Grande's "Court" Knee TattooIn 2018, Grande got her first and only leg tattoo: the name "Court" above her knee. The ink is for one of her closest friends. GettyAriana Grande's Flower Hand TattooGrande appears to have a flower design tattooed on the palm of her right hand.Ariana Grande's "SWT" Finger TattooIn 2019, Grande got "SWT," which stands for "Sweetener" World Tour, tattooed on her right index finger. She got it ahead of her final stop in Los Angeles on Dec. 22. Grande's frequent collaborator producer Tommy Brown shared a photo of the ink. Brown, who captioned the photo "Family Ties," also got inked, as well as producer Steven Franks.GettyAriana Grande's Butterfly Arm TattoosGrande has two intricate butterflies on her arm. However, recent photos point to the possibility that she's getting them removed, similar to the Eevee tattoo on her other arm. Getty | Neil MockfordAriana Grande's "Toulouse" Hand TattooGrande has another hand tattoo, which is an ode to her dog Toulouse.Getty | NBCAriana Grande's "Myron" Ankle TattooGrande used to have an ankle tattoo of the number 8418 in honor of ex-fiancé Pete Davidson's late father, Scott Davidson. The tattoo was the firefighter badge number — Davidson also has it on his forearm. At some point, Grande covered the ink with the name "Myron" for her dog. The late rapper Mac Miller adopted the pet in January 2017, when the two were still a couple, but it continued to live with Grande after they split.Getty | VALERIE MACONAriana Grande's Angel-Wing Ear TattooGrande got a small angel wing tattooed inside her ear. Getty | Steve GranitzAriana Grande's "The Truman Show" Back TattooGrande's back tattoo is from one of her favorite movies, "The Truman Show," starring Jim Carrey. She inked her favorite quote from the movie onto her shoulder.Getty | NBCAriana Grande's "7 Rings" Hand TattooIn 2019, Grande attempted to get two Japanese characters on her hand in honor of her new song, but it didn't go as planned. Instead of spelling out "7 Rings," the characters described a small barbecue grill. Grande responded to fans who pointed out the mistake with a series of tweets that have since been deleted, which read, "Indeed, I left out 'つの指,' which should have gone in between. It hurt like f*ck n still looks tight. I wouldn't have lasted one more symbol lmao. But this spot also peels a ton and won't last so if I miss it enough I'll suffer thru the whole thing next time." She then followed up with, "also...huge fan of tiny bbq grills." The singer later attempted to fix the ink and shared an update with her fans. "Slightly better. Thanks to my tutor for helping me fix and to @kanenavasard for being a legend. And to my doctor for the lidocaine shots (no joke). Rip tiny charcoal grill. Miss u man. I actually really liked u." Instagram | arianagrandeAriana Grande's Eevee Arm TattooIn 2019, Grande added the Pokémon character Eevee to her left arm. When she shared a snap of the design on her Instagram Stories, she wrote, "I've wanted this for so long." However, 2025 red carpet appearances of the tar suggest she's getting it lasered off, as the design is barely noticeable anymore. GettyAriana Grande's "Always" and Leaf Side TattooGrande's side used to have a tattoo of "always," written in Pete Davidson's handwriting. In 2019, she added a stem of leaves to the area, but she noted she wasn't trying to hide the original ink. She captioned her Instagram photo, "Post run thrus, 3 am with @girlknewyork :) not a cover up just evolvin."Ariana Grande's Moon, Sun, and Stars Hand TattooAfter being named Woman of the Year by Billboard in 2018, Grande got a large tattoo featuring a crescent moon, sun, and stars on her hand. Her moon tattoos are some of her most popular, and this is a fan favorite.GettyAriana Grande's "Let's Sing" Arm TattooGrande has the phrase "let's sing" tattooed in Japanese above her left inner elbow.Getty | NBCAriana Grande's Moon and Stars Foot TattooGrande has a few celestial-themed designs, including a crescent moon and star ink on her foot. She got it in 2018.Instagram | arianagrandeAriana Grande's Chihiro Arm TattooIn 2018, Grande got a tattoo of Chihiro, the main character from the 2001 film "Spirited Away." Grande showed off the new ink on her forearm. A dedicated fan of Hayao Miyazaki's films, Grande told fans the permanent significance behind Chihiro in a now-expired Instagram Story. According to Grande, this character sheds her own fears throughout the film and matures into a "courageous, quick-witted, and reliable girl." It makes sense that Grande would resonate with the movie's brave heroine.Getty | ANGELA WEISSAriana Grande's "REM" Ear TattooGrande got a small tattoo that says "REM," a song from her "Sweetener" album, behind her right ear.GettyAriana Grande's Hip TattooGrande has a tiny phrase tattooed on her hip that fans have tried unsuccessfully to decipher.Getty | Gilbert FloresAriana Grande's Manchester Bee Ear TattooThe singer tattooed a bee design behind her ear as a tribute to the devastating Manchester attack, which took place while she was performing in May 2017. She and a few members of her crew got the design together.Getty | Jason LaVerisAriana Grande's "Hi" Toe TattooGrande has a very tiny tattoo on her toe that says "hi." On a different toe, she also has a heart tattoo. GettyAriana Grande's Crescent-Moon Neck TattooAriana Grande's moon tattoo, which she debuted back in 2014, was one of her firsts.Getty | Tristan FewingsAriana Grande's "Bellissima" Side TattooGrande has the word "Bellissima" — a nickname given to her by her grandfather — written in script on her left rib cage.Getty | Jason MerrittAriana Grande's "Mille Tendresse" Neck TattooThe ink on the back of Grande's neck reads "Mille Tendresse," which means "a thousand tendernesses." It was reportedly inspired by a phrase from the movie "Breakfast at Tiffany's." Nykia Spradley is a former PS contributor.Jessica Harrington (she/her) is the senior editor of PS Beauty, where she oversees coverage around makeup, skin care, hair, tattoos, and more. With more than eight years of industry experience, she has interviewed countless celebrities, reported on hundreds of beauty trends, and swatched more lipsticks than she can count. Prior to PS, Jessica worked for publications such as Makeup.com, Skincare.com, and The Zoe Report.
html:
Ariana Grande's tattoo collection has been in the making for years. She may not be the most tattooed celebrity in history, but her collection of ink is still pretty impressive. Over the years, the "Wicked" star has amassed more than 50 designs, and she doesn't appear to be slowing down anytime soon. In fact, she revealed in a recent interview on "The Kelly Clarkson Show" that she and costar Cynthia Erivo have gotten a bunch of new designs for the movie, including a few matching inks and an illustration of the original Glinda from the 1900s book.

Grande's tattoos span her entire body, from her neck down to her feet, and each one is uniquely her. Many tell a story and hold sentimental value. She has a tattoo of the nickname her grandfather gave her, a few that reference her favorite movies, and various other culture–related designs (like a "Breakfast at Tiffany's" quote). She also has a long list of designs that represent her career in music, like a "Sweetener" World Tour tattoo she got with her bandmates. But that's not to say that all of Grande's tattoos are meticulously thought out or always go as planned. There was that incident with the infamous "7 Rings" tattoo, and over the years, she's had to get quite a few old tattoos from past relationships covered up.

Some of the star's designs are in not-so-obvious spots, like her ribcage, while others are on full display. By far, her easiest designs to spy are her many hand and finger tattoos. The star has also been slowly getting a handful of her older designs lasered off, including the Eevee "Pokémon" tattoo on her inner arm. But fear not: we rounded up her full collection ahead.

To get a closer look at Grande's tattoos and learn about their meanings, read on.

Ariana Grande's "For Good" Palm Tattoo

On the inside of Grande's hand, she has a script tattoo of the famous phrase, "For Good." The design matches one on Erivo's opposite palm, so they touch when they hold hands, according to the actors.

Ariana Grande's "E" Heart Tattoo

Grande and Erivo got a watching heart tattoo on the back of their legs. Grande's ink has an "E" for Elphaba, and Erivo's heart has a "G" for Glinda.

Ariana Grande's Original Glinda Illustration Tattoo

Grande has a tattoo of Glinda on the back of her right hand from the original "The Wonderful Wizard of Oz" book by L. Frank Baum, which was published in 1900. In the tattoo, the good witch is drawn sitting in a chair with a clock behind her.

"When they come to me, I just get them," the actor said of the ink in a 2023 interview with Allure. "This one I knew I wanted to get for a very long time. . . I waited forever to fill up this hand. And I thought, 'I'm gonna wait for the right thing to come along,' and yeah, that felt very right."

Ariana Grande's Poppy Flower Hand Tattoo

Sometime in 2023 while filming "Wicked," Grande added a poppy flower tattoo to the side of her right hand. The design is in black ink. Erivo also has one on the side of her hand to match.

Ariana Grande's Umbrella Hand Tattoo

On the side of her left hand, Grande has a tiny umbrella tattoo next to the larger moon design.

Ariana Grande's Saturn Hand Tattoo

Along with the rest of her collection of hand tattoos, Grande has a tiny design of Saturn on her left hand.

Ariana Grande's Right Hand and Finger Tattoos

Grande has a long list of finger and hand tattoos. On her right hand, she has more than 10 designs.

Ariana Grande's "Honeymoon" Finger Tattoo
In honor of her The Honeymoon Tour for her first album, Grande got the word "Honeymoon" inked on the side of her middle finger.

Ariana Grande's "Baby Doll" Finger Tattoo
Another early tattoo of Grande's is the words "Baby Doll" inked on the other side of her middle finger. It's the nickname her nonna called her.

Ariana Grande's Heart Finger Tattoo
On the top of her ring finger, Grande has the outline of a heart in black ink.

Ariana Grande's "אלד" Finger Tattoo
Next to the heart ink is a middle-finger tattoo of the Hebrew phrase "אלד." She got it in 2014 and it means "guarding and protecting."

Ariana Grande's "A" Finger Tattoo
In 2016, Grande got an "A" tattooed on her thumb for one of her closest friends, Alexa.

Ariana Grande's "Lumos" Hand Tattoo
Grande has the word "lumos" — a spell used in the Harry Potter series to produce light — tattooed on her left hand. However, it appears she covered it up with a branch.

Ariana Grande's "H2GKMO" Finger Tattoo

Another popular Grande finger tattoo is the acronym for her favorite phrase, "Honest to God, Knock Me Out," on her right thumb.

Ariana Grande's "9 3/4" Finger Tattoo
On her index finger, Grande has another Harry Potter tattoo: the number "9 3/4" for platform 9 3/4 at King's Cross Station. However, she's since covered it with a branch of laurel leaves that wraps around her finger.

Ariana Grande's "GWS" Finger Tattoo
Grande added a tattoo that reads "GWS" for "Get Well Soon" to her collection of finger designs in June 2020. The ink, on her ring finger, is for her song off the "Sweetener" album.

Ariana Grande's "XV" Finger Tattoo
The Roman numeral "XV" is inked on Grande's right pinky finger. It represents her wedding date to Dalton Gomez: May 15, 2021.

Ariana Grande's "For Good" Hand Tattoo
In May 2023, fans spotted a new tattoo on Grande's palm. It reads "for good," presumably in honor of her role as Glinda in the upcoming film adaptation of the Broadway musical "Wicked."

Ariana Grande's Left Hand and Finger Tattoos

Grande's left hand is equally decorated with ink. She has more than 10 designs.

Ariana Grande's Venus Finger Tattoo
One of Grande's most famous finger tattoos is the Venus symbol on her left hand. It can be seen on her finger just above the knuckle.

Ariana Grande's Cloud Finger Tattoo
On her left hand, Grande has a small cloud hovering above the Venus symbol. She got the design with Pete Davidson when they were dating.

Ariana Grande's "561" Finger Tattoo
The area code 561 for her hometown, Boca Raton, FL, is inked on Grande's left thumb.

Ariana Grande's "Reborn" Hand Tattoo
In 2018, Grande and Davidson got matching hand tattoos that read "reborn." However, after their split, she covered the design with a branch.

Ariana Grande's "Pete" Finger Tattoo
Grande had Davidson's first name, "Pete," tattooed on her ring finger. It's since been covered with a solid black heart.

Ariana Grande's Abstract Finger Tattoos
Grande has a few abstract tattoos on her right hand. This includes a black rectangle that covers the heart ink, some arrow designs, black dots by her fingernails, and an evil-eye tattoo.

Ariana Grande's "Cinderella" Finger Tattoos
After Miller's death, Grande got "Cinderella" tattooed on the inside of her left index finger. It's for the rapper's song by the same name, which was written for her.

Ariana Grande's "Baby" Arm Tattoo

Some eagle-eyed fans noticed that Grande has a tattoo that says "baby" on her left arm. It's near her Eevee body art and under her butterfly designs.

Ariana Grande's "Court" Knee Tattoo

In 2018, Grande got her first and only leg tattoo: the name "Court" above her knee. The ink is for one of her closest friends.

Ariana Grande's Flower Hand Tattoo

Grande appears to have a flower design tattooed on the palm of her right hand.

Ariana Grande's "SWT" Finger Tattoo

In 2019, Grande got "SWT," which stands for "Sweetener" World Tour, tattooed on her right index finger. She got it ahead of her final stop in Los Angeles on Dec. 22. Grande's frequent collaborator producer Tommy Brown shared a photo of the ink. Brown, who captioned the photo "Family Ties," also got inked, as well as producer Steven Franks.

Ariana Grande's Butterfly Arm Tattoos

Grande has two intricate butterflies on her arm. However, recent photos point to the possibility that she's getting them removed, similar to the Eevee tattoo on her other arm.

Ariana Grande's "Toulouse" Hand Tattoo

Grande has another hand tattoo, which is an ode to her dog Toulouse.

Ariana Grande's "Myron" Ankle Tattoo

Grande used to have an ankle tattoo of the number 8418 in honor of ex-fiancé Pete Davidson's late father, Scott Davidson. The tattoo was the firefighter badge number — Davidson also has it on his forearm.

At some point, Grande covered the ink with the name "Myron" for her dog. The late rapper Mac Miller adopted the pet in January 2017, when the two were still a couple, but it continued to live with Grande after they split.

Ariana Grande's Angel-Wing Ear Tattoo

Grande got a small angel wing tattooed inside her ear.

Ariana Grande's "The Truman Show" Back Tattoo

Grande's back tattoo is from one of her favorite movies, "The Truman Show," starring Jim Carrey. She inked her favorite quote from the movie onto her shoulder.

Ariana Grande's "7 Rings" Hand Tattoo

In 2019, Grande attempted to get two Japanese characters on her hand in honor of her new song, but it didn't go as planned. Instead of spelling out "7 Rings," the characters described a small barbecue grill.

Grande responded to fans who pointed out the mistake with a series of tweets that have since been deleted, which read, "Indeed, I left out 'つの指,' which should have gone in between. It hurt like f*ck n still looks tight. I wouldn't have lasted one more symbol lmao. But this spot also peels a ton and won't last so if I miss it enough I'll suffer thru the whole thing next time." She then followed up with, "also...huge fan of tiny bbq grills."

The singer later attempted to fix the ink and shared an update with her fans. "Slightly better. Thanks to my tutor for helping me fix and to @kanenavasard for being a legend. And to my doctor for the lidocaine shots (no joke). Rip tiny charcoal grill. Miss u man. I actually really liked u."

Ariana Grande's Eevee Arm Tattoo

In 2019, Grande added the Pokémon character Eevee to her left arm. When she shared a snap of the design on her Instagram Stories, she wrote, "I've wanted this for so long." However, 2025 red carpet appearances of the tar suggest she's getting it lasered off, as the design is barely noticeable anymore.

Ariana Grande's "Always" and Leaf Side Tattoo

Grande's side used to have a tattoo of "always," written in Pete Davidson's handwriting. In 2019, she added a stem of leaves to the area, but she noted she wasn't trying to hide the original ink. She captioned her Instagram photo, "Post run thrus, 3 am with @girlknewyork :) not a cover up just evolvin."

Ariana Grande's Moon, Sun, and Stars Hand Tattoo

After being named Woman of the Year by Billboard in 2018, Grande got a large tattoo featuring a crescent moon, sun, and stars on her hand. Her moon tattoos are some of her most popular, and this is a fan favorite.

Ariana Grande's "Let's Sing" Arm Tattoo

Grande has the phrase "let's sing" tattooed in Japanese above her left inner elbow.

Ariana Grande's Moon and Stars Foot Tattoo

Grande has a few celestial-themed designs, including a crescent moon and star ink on her foot. She got it in 2018.

Ariana Grande's Chihiro Arm Tattoo

In 2018, Grande got a tattoo of Chihiro, the main character from the 2001 film "Spirited Away." Grande showed off the new ink on her forearm. A dedicated fan of Hayao Miyazaki's films, Grande told fans the permanent significance behind Chihiro in a now-expired Instagram Story. According to Grande, this character sheds her own fears throughout the film and matures into a "courageous, quick-witted, and reliable girl." It makes sense that Grande would resonate with the movie's brave heroine.

Ariana Grande's "REM" Ear Tattoo

Grande got a small tattoo that says "REM," a song from her "Sweetener" album, behind her right ear.

Ariana Grande's Hip Tattoo

Grande has a tiny phrase tattooed on her hip that fans have tried unsuccessfully to decipher.

Ariana Grande's Manchester Bee Ear Tattoo

The singer tattooed a bee design behind her ear as a tribute to the devastating Manchester attack, which took place while she was performing in May 2017. She and a few members of her crew got the design together.

Ariana Grande's "Hi" Toe Tattoo

Grande has a very tiny tattoo on her toe that says "hi." On a different toe, she also has a heart tattoo.

Ariana Grande's Crescent-Moon Neck Tattoo

Ariana Grande's moon tattoo, which she debuted back in 2014, was one of her firsts.

Ariana Grande's "Bellissima" Side Tattoo

Grande has the word "Bellissima" — a nickname given to her by her grandfather — written in script on her left rib cage.

Ariana Grande's "Mille Tendresse" Neck Tattoo

The ink on the back of Grande's neck reads "Mille Tendresse," which means "a thousand tendernesses." It was reportedly inspired by a phrase from the movie "Breakfast at Tiffany's."

Nykia Spradley is a former PS contributor.

Jessica Harrington (she/her) is the senior editor of PS Beauty, where she oversees coverage around makeup, skin care, hair, tattoos, and more. With more than eight years of industry experience, she has interviewed countless celebrities, reported on hundreds of beauty trends, and swatched more lipsticks than she can count. Prior to PS, Jessica worked for publications such as Makeup.com, Skincare.com, and The Zoe Report.
